name: bleeding
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of losing blood from the body: Blood clotting is the body's way to stop bleeding. to stanch/staunch/stem (= stop) the bleeding Some of these remedies can cause internal bleeding.
(in the past) a treatment for illness that consisted of taking blood from someone or making someone lose blood: Bleeding was one of the most common treatments at that time. The child was taken ill and the doctor recommended bleeding with leeches.
More examplesFewer examplesDoctors struggled to stop the bleeding.She rushed over and applied bandages to stanch the bleeding.If the bleeding persists, take the child to a hospital.Millions of Americans pop these pills daily, and complications like stomach bleeding lead to hospitalizations and deaths each year.The condition can cause excessive menstrual bleeding.Treatments typical of 18th-century medicine included bleeding, mercury, powerful laxatives and drugs that induced vomiting (emetics).
